document_data.caption: A map of Silla showing the location of the Malu River.
document_data.name: Malu River
document_data.aliases: Yalu River<ref group="note">The Malu River is named the "Yalu River" on the map accompanying ''[[Kara-Tur: The Eastern Realms]]''. Like many sites in Koryo, this shares a name with a real-world counterpart: the [[Wikipedia:Yalu River|Yalu River]] or Amnok River, which lies on the border between North Korea and China.
document_data.mainbody: The '''Malu River''' was a river in the kingdom of [[Koryo]] in [[Kara-Tur]].
document_data.Geography: Found on the eastern edge of Koryo, the Malu River began high in the [[Sillan Mountains]], then ran south alongside the [[Vorkani Mountains]]. It then turned east through the [[Quang Muku Forest]] and emptied into the sea at [[Foo Nakar]].
document_data.Settlements:
The largest settlement on the Malu River was the city of Foo Nakar, which lay at its mouth.

Lying near the headwaters of the Malu was the village of [[Mu Tong]].
document_data.History: In the midâ€“14th century [[DR]], pirates plying the Malu River once raided Foo Nakar. They were routed in a defense led by [[Pouri Lam]], mistress of the city.
